benchmark_details.name: VLM2-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: VLM2-Bench is a benchmark designed to assess whether vision-language models (VLMs) can visually link matching cues across multiple images and videos, featuring 9 subtasks and over 3,000 test cases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capability of vision-language models in visually linking matching cues, a skill crucial for coherent multimodal reasoning.

data.source: Curated from multiple sources ensuring diversity in visual cue representation.
data.format: Various including True/False, multiple-choice, numerical, and open-ended
data.annotation: Semi-automated with human verification for quality control.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy computed based on paired evaluation of question-answer correctness.
methodology.interpretation: Measured accuracy signifies how well models link and identify visual cues.
methodology.baseline_results: Chance-level and human-level baselines were established for comparison.
methodology.validation: Verification through inter-annotator agreements resulting in a high Fleissâ€™ Kappa score.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data maintained under CC-BY 4.0 license for academic use with attribution.
